sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: This procedure sets the seed for sequences of pseudo-random numbers produced by Rand.Real and Rand.Int. This allows identical executions of the same program to produce identical results.
sections.text_content: This procedure sets the seed for sequences of pseudo-random numbers produced by Rand.Real and Rand.Int. This allows identical executions of the same program to produce identical results.
sections.mdown_content: This procedure sets the seed for sequences of pseudo-random numbers produced by **Rand.Real** and **Rand.Int**. This allows identical executions of the same program to produce identical results.

sections.title: Example
code:
Rand.Set (16#1234ABCD)
        loop
            put "Rolled ", Rand.Int (1, 6)
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die. Each time the program runs, the same sequence of rolls occurs.
sections.text_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die. Each time the program runs, the same sequence of rolls occurs.
sections.mdown_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die. Each time the program runs, the same sequence of rolls occurs.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
If Rand.Reset and Rand.Set are not used, each time a program runs Rand.Real and Rand.Int use a different pseudo-random number sequence. To get the same sequence each time (actually, to start the sequence at a different point), use Rand.Reset or Rand.Set.

To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.text_content:
If Rand.Reset and Rand.Set are not used, each time a program runs Rand.Real and Rand.Int use a different pseudo-random number sequence. To get the same sequence each time (actually, to start the sequence at a different point), use Rand.Reset or Rand.Set.
To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.mdown_content:
If **Rand.Reset** and **Rand.Set** are not used, each time a program runs **Rand.Real** and **Rand.Int** use a different pseudo-random number sequence. To get the same sequence each time (actually, to start the sequence at a different point), use **Rand.Reset** or **Rand.Set**.

To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the **Rand.Seed** and **Rand.Next** procedures.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Set, not by calling Set.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Set, not by calling Set.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Rand.Set**, not by calling **Set**.

sections.title: See also
sections.text_content: Rand.Reset, Rand.Int, Rand.Real, Rand.Seed and Rand.Next.
